item.description:
Tomorrow evening, members of Boston Poetry are invited to join the workshop for another Discussion at Nine Devotion Street. The format will be as in the past two-part, firstly a conversation (this episode, the use of scientific fact in poetry) followed by a peer critique of members' writing. If you would like to have some recent work reviewed, please either e-mail it to me so I can have it reproduced or bring sufficient copies for perhaps 10 people.

The venue, an apartment, can be I hope easily by starting in Coolidge Corner. Walking down Harvard Street and then taking a right will bring you to Babcock Street. Devotion Street will be the first left off of Babcock, and No. 9, the last building on the road before it dead-ends at the park.

The workshop will commence at 7:00 PM. Food and drink will be provided. If before then you have any questions, I can be reached at 617-358-2892, on AIM at "NullaDissolvant", or at zakbos@bu.edu.

Yours sincerely,

Zachary Bos
Organizer
item.name: Tomorrow's Discussion at Nine Devotion
